title: One-Pan Tomato & Spinach Chicken Pasta Recipe
description: You only need 1 pan to cook this easy pasta dish with chicken breast, tomatoes, and spinach
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Everyday Cooking One-Pan Tomato & Spinach Chicken Pasta 4.6 (31) 28 Reviews 11 Photos Our version of an Italian classic uses just one skillet and takes just 40 minutes to prepare! Savory Swanson Chicken Broth, red wine, and tomatoes create a flavorful simmering sauce for the chicken and pasta ensuring a restaurant-quality dish you will both enjoy! By Staff Author Published on September 7, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 10 ounces boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1 inch pieces 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 medium onion, chopped ¼ cup red wine 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with basil, garlic, and oregano, undrained 1 cup Swanson® Chicken Broth 4 ounces uncooked penne pasta ¾ cup water 4 cups baby spinach Directions Season the chicken as desired. Heat the oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until well browned, stirring often. Remove the chicken from the skillet. Add the onion to the skillet and cook until tender-crisp, stirring occasionally. Add the wine and heat to a boil, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Stir in the tomatoes, Swanson Chicken Broth, penne, and water; heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes or until the penne is tender, stirring occasionally. Return the chicken to the skillet. Cook for 2 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Stir in the spinach and cook for 1 minute or until the spinach is wilted. Add Your Photo Photos of One-Pan Tomato & Spinach Chicken Pasta 01 of 11 Photo by  Swanson 02 of 11 Photo by  pollyjanos 02/02/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort I made this the other night and it was very good. I used basil, oregano and fresh garlic as I didn't have the Italian seasoned tomatoes, otherwise followed the recipe exactly. I did find the sauce too soupy and thin so I added 1/4 cup tomato paste and that did the trick. The dish was tasty and hubby impressed so it was a win-win! I served with parmesan and chili pepper (we like spice) and a side of garlic bread. 03 of 11 Photo by  PadrePaul Ballin 11/12/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow Came together very quickly!No changes, but added grated parmesan before servingGreat taste 04 of 11 Photo by  LoftySquid1191 11/11/2023 Loved it. Just didn’t care for the broth in the recipe. Everything else tasted Great 🥰 05 of 11 Photo by  Erin Munson 11/10/2023 This recipe is a win. Easy enough for a weeknight dinner. Things I added: 1 orange bell pepper, 5 cloves minced garlic, I seasoned the chicken with salt pepper, and Italian seasoning. I also added additional basil, oregano and red pepper flakes. This was plenty flavorful! 06 of 11 Photo by  DREGINEK 08/22/2023 AHHH-SOME! Used trimmed, cubed chicken thighs vs breasts. Seasoned only with S&P. In step 2, once the onions were soft, added 2 cloves of minced garlic and the red wine BUT! Cooked until the wine was nearly cooked off - absorbing into the onions/garlic. Since I had fresh tomatoes from my garden - used nearly 2c in lieu of canned AND 2tsp each dried oregano and basil upon adding them to the pot. I used 2c chicken broth (IPO the water) and 1.5 c dried penne. I had put out Parmesan cheese on the table in case this needed a “boost” of flavor but, no one added it!! Absolutely delicious!! Thanks Staff Author - whomever you are! This is a great recipe! 07 of 11 Photo by  SneakySpud3835 08/02/2023 08 of 11 Photo by  Michelle Borton Maudlin 06/17/2023 I doubled the recipe so there would be leftovers... It was a very good dish and so easy! I was worried that the spinach wouldn't all stir in but it absolutely did! Definitely a keeper. (Wasn't sure what wine to use so I ended up just using a decent bottle of a red blend. Nice flavor profile!) Oh I also seasoned the chicken heavily with a Cajun seasoning... Nice!!! 09 of 11 Photo by  PerkyVeal8192 03/26/2023 I enjoyed making this dish and enjoyed eating it even more. I like my food well seasoned, so I seasoned my chicken with Slap Ya Mama, and added a pinch more to the pan while stirring all the ingredients together. This was a delicious, quick meal. I'm definitely making it again. I would cook this for lunch, invite some friends and family over, and serve it with a side of garlic bread! 10 of 11 Photo by  squirllhunter 01/25/2023 New to cooking so I whish they said what to season the chicken with so I just guessed ..plus I Had to add more broth to help the pasta cook but it was really good. When the wife and kids get home that will be the real test haha 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Creamy Pasta Primavera with Chicken and Sausage 1 Rating Buffalo Chicken Pasta Bake Lower-Calorie Buffalo Chicken Pasta 3 Ratings Chicken Alfredo with Fettuccini Noodles 298 Ratings Salmon and Spinach Fettuccine 197 Ratings Fettuccine with Chicken, Leeks, and Gorgonzola 4 Ratings Chicken Alfredo 428 Ratings Spinach, Mushroom, and Ricotta Fettuccine 20 Ratings Spicy Shrimp Fettuccine with Garlic and Tomatoes 22 Ratings Chicken Piccata with Fettuccine 13 Ratings Joel's Jerk Chicken Pineapple Pasta 119 Ratings San Marzano Penne Vodka 30 Ratings Cajun Shrimp and Sausage Alfredo 1 Rating Singapore Noodles 135 Ratings Fettuccine Carbonara 550 Ratings Chicken and Asparagus Fettuccine 130 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Allrecipes
instructions: Season the chicken as desired. Heat the oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until well browned, stirring often. Remove the chicken from the skillet.;Add the onion to the skillet and cook until tender-crisp, stirring occasionally. Add the wine and heat to a boil, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet.;Stir in the tomatoes, Swanson Chicken Broth, penne, and water; heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes or until the penne is tender, stirring occasionally. Return the chicken to the skillet. Cook for 2 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Stir in the spinach and cook for 1 minute or until the spinach is wilted.
